intro: Randia micracantha var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glabrous, giving it its varietal name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for ornamental use in warm climates. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
